question: Is the most favorited author mainly communicating in Spanish?
sql: SELECT lang, COUNT(*) AS num_favorites FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY num_favorites DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Does the author with the longest name post mainly original content?
sql:
SELECT "author_name", "type"
     FROM "050_ING"
     WHERE "type" = 'original'
     ORDER BY LENGTH("author_name") DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Is there an author who received no retweets for any of their posts?
sql: SELECT DISTINCT "author_name" FROM "050_ING" WHERE "retweets" = 0;

question: Are there any posts that do not contain any links?
sql: SELECT * FROM "050_ING" WHERE links IS NULL;

question: How many unique authors are in the dataset?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT author_name) FROM "050_ING";

question: What is the length of the longest post (based on the number of words)?
sql: SELECT MAX(length(text)) AS longest_post FROM "050_ING";

question: What is the total number of retweets received by all authors in the dataset?
sql: SELECT SUM(retweets) AS total_retweets FROM "050_ING";

question: How many posts do not contain any mentions of other users?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "050_ING" WHERE mention_ids IS NULL;

question: What is the name of the most retweeted author?
sql: SELECT author_name, SUM(retweets) AS total_retweets FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY author_name ORDER BY total_retweets DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the language of the most favorited post?
sql: SELECT lang, SUM(favorites) AS total_favorites FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY total_favorites DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who is the author of the post with the most words?
sql: SELECT "author_name", COUNT(*) AS word_count FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY "author_name" ORDER BY word_count DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What type of post (original, reply, or other) is the most common in the dataset?
sql: SELECT type, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY type ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who are the authors of the top 3 most retweeted posts?
sql: SELECT "author_name", SUM("retweets") AS total_retweets FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY "author_name" ORDER BY total_retweets DESC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the languages of the 5 least favorited posts?
sql: SELECT lang, SUM(favorites) AS total_favorites FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY total_favorites ASC LIMIT 5;

question: Who are the authors of the 4 shortest posts (based on the number of words)?
sql: SELECT a.author_name, COUNT(*) AS num_posts FROM "050_ING" a JOIN (SELECT MIN(length(text)) AS min_length FROM "050_ING") b ON 1=1 GROUP BY a.author_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 4;

question: What types of posts are the 6 most common in the dataset?
sql: SELECT type, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "050_ING" GROUP BY type ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 6;

question: What are the retweet counts for the top 5 most favorited posts?
sql: SELECT retweets, favorites FROM "050_ING" ORDER BY favorites DESC, retweets DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the word counts of the 3 longest posts?
sql: SELECT LENGTH(text) AS word_count, text FROM "050_ING" ORDER BY word_count DESC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the retweet counts of the 4 least favorited posts?
sql: SELECT retweets, favorites FROM "050_ING" ORDER BY favorites ASC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the word counts for the 6 shortest posts?
sql: SELECT LENGTH(text) AS word_count, text FROM "050_ING" ORDER BY word_count ASC LIMIT 6;

question: Is there a Pokémon named 'Pikachu' in the dataset?
sql: SELECT name FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE name = 'Pikachu';

question: Are there any Pokémon with a total stat greater than 700?
sql: SELECT total FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE total > 700;

question: Are all Pokémon in the first generation legendary?
sql: SELECT legendary FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE generation = 1;

question: Is there any Pokémon with a speed greater than 150?
sql: SELECT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE speed > 150);

question: How many unique Pokémon types are there in the 'type1' column?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT type1) FROM "051_Pokemon";

question: What's the highest total stat value found in the dataset?
sql: SELECT MAX(total) AS max_total FROM "051_Pokemon";

question: How many Pokémon are there in the third generation?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE generation = 3;

question: What is the average attack stat for all Pokémon?
sql: SELECT AVG(attack) AS average_attack FROM "051_Pokemon";

question: What is the primary type of the Pokémon with the highest defense stat?
sql: SELECT t.type1, MAX(t.defense) AS max_defense FROM "051_Pokemon" t GROUP BY t.type1 ORDER BY max_defense DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which Pokémon has the lowest speed stat?
sql: SELECT name, speed FROM "051_Pokemon" ORDER BY speed ASC LIMIT 1;

question: What secondary type is the most common among legendary Pokémon?
sql: SELECT t2.name AS secondary_type, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "051_Pokemon" p JOIN type2 t2 ON p.type2 = t2.id WHERE p.legendary = 'Yes' GROUP BY t2.name ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which Pokémon has the highest special attack and what is its primary type?
Name the top 3 Pokémon with the highest total stats.
sql:
SELECT p.name, p.total
     FROM "051_Pokemon" p
     ORDER BY p.total DESC NULLS LAST
     LIMIT 3;

question: Which 5 Pokémon have the lowest hp stats?
sql: SELECT name, hp FROM "051_Pokemon" ORDER BY hp ASC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: Name the top 4 primary categories that have the most Pokémon.
sql: SELECT t1.name, COUNT(*) AS num_pokemon FROM "051_Pokemon" p JOIN "052_Type" t1 ON p.type1 = t1.id GROUP BY t1.name ORDER BY num_pokemon DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Which 6 Pokémon from the second generation have the highest attack stats?
sql: SELECT name, attack FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE generation = 2 ORDER BY attack DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 6;

question: What are the top 5 special defense stats in the dataset?
sql: SELECT sp_defense FROM "051_Pokemon" ORDER BY sp_defense DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: list the bottom 3 defense stats of legendary Pokémon.
sql: SELECT p.name, p.defense FROM "051_Pokemon" p WHERE p.legendary = 'Yes' ORDER BY p.defense ASC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the 4 highest speed stats of Pokémon in the fourth generation?
sql: SELECT generation, MAX(speed) AS max_speed FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE generation = 4 GROUP BY generation ORDER BY max_speed DESC LIMIT 4;

question: list the 6 lowest total stats of non-legendary Pokémon.
sql: SELECT * FROM (SELECT * FROM "051_Pokemon" WHERE legendary = 'No' ORDER BY total ASC LIMIT 6) AS subquery;

question: Is the maximum level of Extraversion greater than the maximum level of Agreeableness?
sql: SELECT MAX(Extraversion) > MAX(Agreeableness) AS comparison_result FROM "052_Professional";

question: Is the profession with the highest Openness the same as the profession with the highest Conscientousness?
sql: SELECT (SELECT Profession FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY Openness DESC LIMIT 1) = (SELECT Profession FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY Conscientousness DESC LIMIT 1) AS same_profession;

question: Does the profession with the lowest Emotional_Range also have the lowest level of Conversation?
sql: SELECT p.Profession, p.Emotional_Range, p.Conversation FROM "052_Professional" p ORDER BY p.Emotional_Range ASC, p.Conversation ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Is the average level of Openness to Change higher than the average level of Hedonism?
sql: SELECT (AVG("Openness to Change") > AVG(Hedonism)) AS is_higher FROM "052_Professional";

question: What is the maximum value of Self-enhancement across all professions?
sql: SELECT MAX("Self-enhancement") AS max_self_enhancement FROM "052_Professional";

question: How many professions have an Emotional_Range above 0.5?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "052_Professional" WHERE Emotional_Range > 0.5;

question: What is the average Extraversion level for the profession with the highest number of records (n)?
sql: SELECT p.Profession, AVG(p.Extraversion) AS average_extraversion FROM "052_Professional" p GROUP BY p.Profession ORDER BY n DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the minimum level of Self-transcendence?
sql: SELECT MIN("elf-transcendence") AS min_self_transcendence FROM "052_Professional";

question: What profession has the highest level of Conscientiousness?
sql: SELECT Profession, MAX(Conscientousness) AS max_conscientiousness FROM "052_Professional" GROUP BY Profession ORDER BY max_conscientiousness DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the profession with the lowest level of Hedonism?
sql: SELECT Profession, MIN(Hedonism) AS min_hedonism FROM "052_Professional" GROUP BY Profession ORDER BY min_hedonism ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Which profession has the highest Emotional_Range?
sql: SELECT Profession, MAX(Emotional_Range) AS max_emotional_range FROM "052_Professional" GROUP BY Profession ORDER BY max_emotional_range DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 1;

question: What is the profession with the highest number of records (n)?
sql: SELECT Profession, n FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY n DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What are the top 3 professions with the highest Openness?
sql: SELECT p.Profession, p.Openness FROM "052_Professional" p ORDER BY p.Openness DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 3;

question: Which are the bottom 4 professions in terms of Agreeableness?
sql:
SELECT Profession, Agreeableness
     FROM "052_Professional"
     ORDER BY Agreeableness ASC
     LIMIT 4;

question: List the top 5 professions with the highest Conversation levels.
answer: ['Director of Athletics', 'Recruiting Coordinator', 'Athletic Coordinator', 'Director of Personnel', 'Skills Trainer']
sql: SELECT p.Profession, p.Conversation FROM "052_Professional" p ORDER BY p.Conversation DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: Name the bottom 2 professions in terms of Self-enhancement.
sql: SELECT p.Profession, p."Self-enhancement" FROM "052_Professional" p ORDER BY p."Self-enhancement" ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 3 values of Openness to Change across all professions?
sql: SELECT Profession, "Openness to Change" FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY "Openness to Change" DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 3;

question: List the bottom 4 Emotional_Range values.
sql: SELECT Emotional_Range FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY Emotional_Range ASC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the highest 5 levels of Extraversion?
sql: SELECT "Extraversion" FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY "Extraversion" DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: Name the lowest 6 levels of Self-transcendence.
sql: SELECT "Self-transcendence" FROM "052_Professional" ORDER BY "Self-transcendence" ASC NULLS LAST LIMIT 6;

question: Is there a patent related to 'communication' in the title?
sql: SELECT title FROM "053_Patents" WHERE title ilike '%communication%';

question: Are there patents associated with the organization 'IBM'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "053_Patents" WHERE organization = 'IBM';

question: Is there a patent abstract that mentions 'software'?
sql: SELECT abstract FROM "053_Patents" WHERE abstract ilike '%software%';

question: Are there patents of the 'design' type?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "053_Patents" WHERE type = 'design';

question: How many unique organizations have patents listed?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT organization) FROM "053_Patents";

question: On average, how many claims do the patents have?
sql: SELECT AVG(num_claims) AS average_claims FROM "053_Patents";

question: What's the highest number of claims a patent has?
sql: SELECT MAX(num_claims) AS max_num_claims FROM "053_Patents";

question: How many patents are of 'utility' type?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "053_Patents" WHERE type = 'utility';

question: Which organization has the patent with the highest number of claims?
sql: SELECT organization, num_claims FROM "053_Patents" ORDER BY num_claims DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which kind of patent is the most common?
sql: SELECT kind, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "053_Patents" GROUP BY kind ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: In which language are the patents written?
sql: SELECT lang FROM "053_Patents";

question: Which graphext cluster is the most common among the patents?
sql: SELECT graphext_cluster, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "053_Patents" GROUP BY graphext_cluster ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which are the top 3 organizations with the most patents?
answer: ['International Business Machines Corporation', 'Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.', 'Google Inc.']
sql: SELECT organization, COUNT(*) AS num_patents FROM "053_Patents" GROUP BY organization ORDER BY num_patents DESC LIMIT 3;

question: List the 4 most common types of patents in the dataset.
sql: SELECT type, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "053_Patents" GROUP BY type ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Which 5 kinds of patents are the most prevalent?
sql: SELECT kind, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "053_Patents" GROUP BY kind ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 5;

question: List 2 least common graphext clusters among the patents.
answer: ['habit, plant, foliage, flowers', 'soybean, plant, cultivar, soybean cultivar']
sql: SELECT graphext_cluster, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "053_Patents" GROUP BY graphext_cluster ORDER BY frequency ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 4 numbers of claims in the patents?
sql: SELECT num_claims FROM "053_Patents" ORDER BY num_claims DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 4;

question: List the 3 patents (by ID) with the most number of claims.
sql: SELECT p.id, p.num_claims FROM "053_Patents" p ORDER BY p.num_claims DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 3;

question: Which 5 patents (by ID) have the most targets associated?
sql: SELECT p.id, COUNT(p.target) AS target_count FROM "053_Patents" p GROUP BY p.id ORDER BY target_count DESC LIMIT 5;

question: List the 6 most recent patents by their ID.
sql: SELECT id, date FROM "053_Patents" ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 6;

question: Has the author with the highest number of followers ever been verified?
sql: SELECT "author_id<gx:category>", MAX("user_followers_count<gx:number>") AS max_followers, MIN("user_verified<gx:boolean>") AS min_verified FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_id<gx:category>" HAVING MAX("user_followers_count<gx:number>") > 1000 AND MIN("user_verified<gx:boolean>") = TRUE;

question: Is the author who has the most favourites also the one with the most retweets?
sql: SELECT "author_id<gx:category>", MAX("user_favourites_count<gx:number>") AS max_favourites, MAX("retweets<gx:number>") AS max_retweets FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_id<gx:category>" ORDER BY max_favourites DESC, max_retweets DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Is the most mentioned user also the most retweeted user?
sql:
SELECT "author_id<gx:category>", COUNT("mention_names<gx:list[category]>") AS num_mentions, SUM("retweets<gx:number>") AS total_retweets
     FROM "054_Joe"
     GROUP BY "author_id<gx:category>"
     ORDER BY num_mentions DESC, total_retweets DESC
     LIMIT 1;

question: Does the author with the most retweets also have the most replies?
sql: SELECT "author_id<gx:category>", MAX("retweets<gx:number>") AS max_retweets, MAX("replies<gx:number>") AS max_replies FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_id<gx:category>" ORDER BY max_retweets DESC, max_replies DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the maximum number of followers an author in the dataset has?
sql: SELECT MAX("user_followers_count") AS max_followers FROM "054_Joe";

question: How many authors have more than 10,000 favourites?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "054_Joe" WHERE "user_favourites_count" > 10000;

question: How many retweets does the most retweeted tweet have?
sql: SELECT MAX("retweets<gx:number>") AS "max_retweets" FROM "054_Joe";

question: How many times has the most mentioned user been mentioned?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_mentions FROM "054_Joe" WHERE mention_names IS NOT NULL;

question: Who is the author with the most followers?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", MAX("user_followers_count<gx:number>") AS max_followers FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY max_followers DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who is the author with the highest number of favourites?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", MAX("user_favourites_count<gx:number>") AS max_favourites FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY max_favourites DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the name of the user who is most often mentioned?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>" FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY COUNT("mention_names<gx:list[category]>") DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who is the author of the tweet with the most retweets?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", MAX("retweets<gx:number>") AS max_retweets FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY max_retweets DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who are the top 3 authors with the most followers?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", SUM("user_followers_count<gx:number>") AS total_followers FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY total_followers DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Who are the top 4 authors with the most favourites?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", SUM("user_favourites_count<gx:number>") AS total_favourites FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY total_favourites DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Who are the 5 users who are mentioned the most often?
answer: ['Director of Athletics', 'Recruiting Coordinator', 'Athletic Coordinator', 'Director of Personnel', 'Skills Trainer']
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", COUNT(*) AS num_mentions FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY num_mentions DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Who are the top 2 authors of the tweets with the most retweets?
sql: SELECT "author_name<gx:category>", SUM("retweets<gx:number>") AS total_retweets FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "author_name<gx:category>" ORDER BY total_retweets DESC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 3 numbers of followers in the dataset?
sql: SELECT "user_followers_count<gx:number>" AS followers_count, rank() OVER (ORDER BY "user_followers_count<gx:number>" DESC) AS rank FROM "054_Joe" ORDER BY rank ASC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the top 4 numbers of favourites an author in the dataset has?
sql: SELECT user_favourites_count FROM "054_Joe" ORDER BY user_favourites_count DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 4;

question: What are the 5 highest numbers of times a user is mentioned?
sql: SELECT mention_names, COUNT(*) AS num_mentions FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY mention_names ORDER BY num_mentions DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the 2 highest numbers of retweets a tweet in the dataset has?
sql: SELECT MAX("retweets<gx:number>") AS "max_retweets", COUNT(*) AS "num_tweets" FROM "054_Joe" GROUP BY "max_retweets" ORDER BY "max_retweets" DESC LIMIT 2;

question: Is the borrower with the highest loan amount also the one with the longest loan duration?
Does the borrower with the maximum number of existing loans also have the highest loan amount?
sql: SELECT MAX(Number of Existing Loans) AS max_loans, MAX(Loan Amount) AS max_loan_amount FROM "055_German";

question: Does the borrower with the longest loan duration also have the maximum number of existing loans?
Does the oldest borrower also have the highest loan amount?
sql:
SELECT Age, Loan Amount
     FROM "055_German"
     ORDER BY Age ASC, Loan Amount DESC
     LIMIT 1;

question: What is the highest loan amount in the dataset?
sql: SELECT MAX(Loan Amount) AS max_loan_amount FROM "055_German";

question: How many borrowers have more than 1 existing loan?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "055_German" WHERE "Number of Existing Loans" > 1;

question: What is the longest loan duration in the dataset?
sql: SELECT MAX('Loan Duration - Months') AS longest_loan_duration FROM "055_German";

question: How many borrowers are older than 50?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "055_German" WHERE age > 50;

question: What is the most common purpose of loans?
sql: SELECT "Purpose of Loan", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "055_German" GROUP BY "Purpose of Loan" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the most common job category for borrowers?
sql: SELECT Job, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "055_German" GROUP BY Job ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the most common credit history category for borrowers?
answer: Existing Credits Paid Back Duly Till Now
sql: SELECT Credit History, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "055_German" GROUP BY Credit History ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the most common savings account status for borrowers?
sql: SELECT Savings Account, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "055_German" GROUP BY Savings Account ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What are the top 3 jobs of borrowers with the highest loan amount?
sql: SELECT Job, SUM(Loan Amount) AS total_loan_amount FROM "055_German" GROUP BY Job ORDER BY total_loan_amount DESC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the top 4 jobs of borrowers with the longest loan duration?
sql: SELECT Job, MAX(Loan Duration - Months) AS max_duration FROM "055_German" GROUP BY Job ORDER BY max_duration DESC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the 5 jobs of borrowers with the maximum number of existing loans?
sql: SELECT j.job, COUNT(*) AS num_loans FROM "055_German" g JOIN "055_German" j ON g.borrower = j.borrower GROUP BY j.job ORDER BY num_loans DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the jobs of the oldest 2 borrowers?
sql: SELECT "Job" FROM "055_German" ORDER BY "Age" ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 3 loan amounts in the dataset?
sql: SELECT Loan Amount FROM "055_German" ORDER BY Loan Amount DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 3;

question: What are the top 4 loan durations in the dataset?
sql: SELECT Loan Duration - Months FROM 055_German ORDER BY Loan Duration - Months DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 4;

question: What are the 5 maximum numbers of existing loans among borrowers?
sql: SELECT MAX(Number of Existing Loans) AS max_loans FROM "055_German";

question: What are the ages of the top 2 oldest borrowers?
sql: SELECT TOP 2 age FROM "055_German" ORDER BY age DESC NULLS LAST;

question: Are there any foods with zero calories?
sql: SELECT "Calories (kcal)" FROM "056_Emoji" WHERE "Calories (kcal)" = 0;

question: Do all foods contain sugar?
sql: SELECT 'Total Sugar (g)' FROM '056_Emoji';

question: Are there any foods that contain no fat at all?
sql: SELECT "Food" FROM "056_Emoji" WHERE "Total Fat (g)" = 0;

question: Are there foods that do not contain protein?
sql: SELECT "Food" FROM "056_Emoji" WHERE "Protein (g)" IS NULL;

question: How many foods have more than 500 kcal?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "056_Emoji" WHERE "Calories (kcal)" > 500;

question: What is the average amount of total fat (in grams) across all foods?
sql: SELECT AVG(Total Fat (g)) AS average_total_fat FROM "056_Emoji";

question: How many foods have a sodium content of more than 1 gram?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "056_Emoji" WHERE "Sodium (g)" > 1;

question: What's the highest amount of protein (in grams) found in a food item?
sql: SELECT MAX("Protein (g)") FROM "056_Emoji";

question: What food has the highest calorie content?
sql: SELECT name, calories_kcal FROM "056_Emoji" ORDER BY calories_kcal DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which food contains the most sugar?
sql: SELECT name, SUM(Total Sugar (g)) AS total_sugar FROM "056_Emoji" GROUP BY name ORDER BY total_sugar DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the food with the least amount of total fat?
sql: SELECT name, SUM(Total Fat (g)) AS total_fat FROM "056_Emoji" GROUP BY name ORDER BY total_fat ASC LIMIT 1;

question: Which food has the highest amount of protein?
sql: SELECT name, protein_g FROM "056_Emoji" ORDER BY protein_g DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 1;

question: List the top 5 foods with the most calories.
sql: SELECT name, calories_kcal FROM 056_emoji ORDER BY calories_kcal DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: Identify the top 3 foods with the least amount of sugar.
sql: SELECT name, SUM(Total Sugar (g)) AS total_sugar FROM "056_Emoji" GROUP BY name ORDER BY total_sugar ASC LIMIT 3;

question: Enumerate the 4 foods with the most total fat.
sql: SELECT name, SUM(Total Fat (g)) AS total_fat FROM "056_Emoji" GROUP BY name ORDER BY total_fat DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Name the 6 foods with the least amount of protein.
sql: SELECT name, protein_g FROM "056_Emoji" ORDER BY protein_g ASC LIMIT 6;

question: List the 5 highest calorie counts found in the dataset.
sql: SELECT MAX(Calories (kcal)) AS max_calories FROM "056_Emoji";

question: What are the 3 lowest amounts of sugar found among the foods?
sql: SELECT MIN(Total Sugar (g)) AS min_sugar FROM "056_Emoji";

question: Enumerate the 4 highest amounts of total fat found in the foods.
sql: SELECT Total Fat (g) FROM "056_Emoji" ORDER BY Total Fat (g) DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 4;

question: What are the top 6 lowest amounts of protein found in the dataset?
sql: SELECT Protein (g) FROM "056_Emoji" ORDER BY Protein (g) ASC LIMIT 6;

question: Are there any respondents who didn't complete primary education?
sql: SELECT 'edu' FROM '057_Spain' WHERE 'edu' = 'No';

question: Are all respondents interested in politics?
sql: SELECT polInterest FROM "057_Spain"

question: Did any respondent indicate that they will not vote?
sql: SELECT "Vote Intention" FROM "057_Spain" WHERE "Vote Intention" = 'No';

question: Did any respondent place themselves at the extreme right of the Left-Right economic values axis?
columns_used: User self-placement on Left-Right economic values axis
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "057_Spain" WHERE "User self-placement on Left-Right economic values axis" = 'Right';

question: How many respondents placed themselves at 10 on the Progressive-Conservative economic values axis?
columns_used: User self- placement on Progressive-Conservative economic values axis
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "057_Spain" WHERE "User self- placement on Progressive-Conservative economic values axis" = 10;

question: What is the average age of the respondents?
sql: SELECT AVG(Age) AS average_age FROM "057_Spain";

question: How many respondents think it should be more difficult for companies to lay off workers?
columns_used: It should be more difficult for companies to lay off workers
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "057_Spain" WHERE "It should be more difficult for companies to lay off workers" = 'Yes';

question: What's the maximum age among the respondents who prefer not to disclose their gender?
sql: SELECT MAX(age) FROM "057_Spain" WHERE gender IS NULL;

question: Which is the most common vote intention among respondents?
sql: SELECT Vote Intention, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY Vote Intention ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the most common reason for voting given by respondents?
answer: The party ideas are close to my own
sql: SELECT "voteReason", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY "voteReason" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which is the most common party identification among respondents?
sql: SELECT partyId, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY partyId ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the most common first language among respondents?
sql: SELECT lang FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY COUNT(lang) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List the top 5 most common vote intentions among respondents.
sql: SELECT Vote Intention, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY Vote Intention ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Identify the top 3 most common reasons for voting among respondents.
answer: ['The party ideas are close to my own', 'The party is the most competent', 'I prefer not to say']
sql: SELECT voteReason, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY voteReason ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Enumerate the top 4 most common party identifications among respondents.
sql: SELECT partyId, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY partyId ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Name the top 6 most common first languages among respondents.
sql: SELECT lang, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 6;

question: List the top 5 most common ages among respondents.
sql: SELECT age, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY age ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the top 3 most common positions on the Left-Right economic values axis?
columns_used: User self-placement on Left-Right economic values axis
sql: SELECT "User self-placement on Left-Right economic values axis", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY "User self-placement on Left-Right economic values axis" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Enumerate the top 4 most common positions on the Progressive-Conservative economic values axis.
columns_used: User self- placement on Progressive-Conservative economic values axis
sql: SELECT "User self- placement on Progressive-Conservative economic values axis", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY "User self- placement on Progressive-Conservative economic values axis" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the top 6 most common positions on the 'Constitutional organisation of the country (More Descentralization)' scale?
columns_used: Constitutional organisation of the country (More Descentralization)
sql: SELECT "Constitutional organisation of the country (More Descentralization)", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "057_Spain" GROUP BY "Constitutional organisation of the country (More Descentralization)" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 6;

question: Are there survey participants who are not registered to vote?
sql: SELECT "Are you registered to vote?" FROM "058_US" WHERE "Are you registered to vote?" = 'No';

question: Are there any respondents who participated in the 2016 Presidential election (four years ago) but are not planning to do so in the upcoming election?
columns_used: Did you vote in the 2016 Presidential election? (Four years ago)
How likely are you to vote in the forthcoming US Presidential election? Early Voting Open

question: Do we have any respondents in the dataset who didn't participate in the 2016 Presidential election (four years ago) but intend to do so in the upcoming election?
columns_used: Did you vote in the 2016 Presidential election? (Four years ago)
How likely are you to vote in the forthcoming US Presidential election? Early Voting Open

question: Do we have respondents who have shifted their voting preference from the 2016 election (four years ago) to the upcoming one?
columns_used: Who did you vote for in the 2016 Presidential election? (Four years ago)
Who are you most likely to vote for on election day?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "058_US" WHERE "Who did you vote for in the 2016 Presidential election? (Four years ago)"!= "Who are you most likely to vote for on election day?"

question: How many respondents in the survey are eligible to vote?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "058_US" WHERE "Are you registered to vote?" = 'Yes';

question: What is the count of respondents who are leaning towards voting for Joe Biden in the upcoming election?
columns_used: Who are you most likely to vote for on election day?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "058_US" WHERE "Who are you most likely to vote for on election day?" = 'Joe Biden';

question: How many respondents have a high school degree or less as their highest level of education?
columns_used: What is the highest degree or level of school you have *completed* ?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "058_US" WHERE 'What is the highest degree or level of school you have *completed*?' IN ('High school', 'High school or equivalent', 'Some college or equivalent', 'Less than high school');

question: How many respondents are from the region adjacent to the South Atlantic Ocean?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "058_US" WHERE Division = 'South Atlantic';

question: What is the most frequent age group among the respondents?
sql: SELECT CAST(HOW_OLD_ARE_YOU AS INTEGER) AS age_group, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "058_US" GROUP BY age_group ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Who is the preferred choice among the respondents for the upcoming election?
columns_used: Who are you most likely to vote for on election day?
sql: SELECT "Who are you most likely to vote for on election day?" AS preferred_candidate FROM "058_US";

question: What is the most commonly achieved educational level among the respondents?
columns_used: What is the highest degree or level of school you have *completed* ?
sql: SELECT "What is the highest degree or level of school you have *completed*?", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "058_US" GROUP BY "What is the highest degree or level of school you have *completed*?" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which geographical division has the greatest representation among the respondents?
sql: SELECT Division, COUNT(*) AS representation FROM "058_US" GROUP BY Division ORDER BY representation DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Identify the top 5 states with the greatest number of respondents.
sql: SELECT State, COUNT(*) AS num_respondents FROM "058_US" GROUP BY State ORDER BY num_respondents DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Enumerate the top 4 most common professions among the respondents.
answer: ['Other', 'Healthcare', 'Office worker or other professional', 'Industrial (e.g. construction, manufacturing, maintenance and repair)']
columns_used: Which of these best describes the kind of work you do?
sql: SELECT "Which of these best describes the kind of work you do?", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "058_US" GROUP BY "Which of these best describes the kind of work you do?" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Identify the top 3 ethnic groups with the most representation among the respondents.
answer: ['White (not Hispanic, Latino or Spanish origin)', 'Black or African American (not Hispanic, Latino or Spanish origin)', 'Hispanic, Latino or Spanish origin']
columns_used: Which of the following best describes your ethnic heritage?
sql: SELECT "Which of the following best describes your ethnic heritage?", COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "058_US" GROUP BY "Which of the following best describes your ethnic heritage?" ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Enumerate the top 6 most represented age groups among the respondents.
sql: SELECT CAST(HOW_OLD_ARE_YOU AS INTEGER) AS age_group, COUNT(*) AS num_respondents FROM "058_US" GROUP BY age_group ORDER BY num_respondents DESC LIMIT 6;

question: Identify the top 3 counties (using FIPS codes) with the greatest number of respondents.
sql: SELECT "County FIPS", COUNT(*) AS num_respondents FROM "058_US" GROUP BY "County FIPS" ORDER BY num_respondents DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Enumerate the highest 4 unique weight values in the dataset.
sql: SELECT MAX(Weight) AS max_weight FROM "058_US" GROUP BY Weight ORDER BY max_weight DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 4;

question: List the top 5 urban/rural categories (using NCHS codes) with the greatest number of respondents.
sql: SELECT "NCHS Urban/rural", COUNT(*) AS num_respondents FROM "058_US" GROUP BY "NCHS Urban/rural" ORDER BY num_respondents DESC LIMIT 5;

question: Enumerate the top 6 most common likelihood values among the respondents.
sql: SELECT likelihood, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "058_US" GROUP BY likelihood ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 6;

question: Is there a car model named 'Golf' listed?
sql: SELECT model FROM "059_Second" WHERE model ilike '%Golf%';

question: Are there cars associated with the dealer 'Autos Raymara'?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "059_Second" s WHERE s.dealer = 'Autos Raymara';

question: Is there a car version that mentions 'BMW'?
sql: SELECT version FROM "059_Second" WHERE version ilike '%BMW%';

question: Are there cars with a 'Manual' shift?
sql: SELECT 'shift' FROM "059_Second" WHERE 'shift' = 'Manual';

question: How many unique car models are listed?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT model) FROM "059_Second";

question: On average, how many photos are provided for the cars?
sql: SELECT AVG(photos) AS average_photos FROM "059_Second";

question: What's the highest price a car is listed for?
sql: SELECT MAX(price) AS max_price FROM "059_Second";

question: How many cars are from the year 2020?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "059_Second" WHERE year = 2020;

question: Which dealer has the car with the highest price listed?
sql: SELECT dealer, MAX(price) AS max_price FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY dealer;

question: Which car make is the most common?
sql: SELECT make, COUNT(*) AS COUNT FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY make ORDER BY COUNT DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What type of fuel is the most common for the cars?
sql: SELECT fuel, COUNT(*) AS COUNT FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY fuel ORDER BY COUNT DESC LIMIT 1;

question: In which province are the most cars located?
sql: SELECT province, COUNT(*) AS num_cars FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY province ORDER BY num_cars DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which are the top 3 provinces with the most car listings?
sql: SELECT province, COUNT(*) AS num_listings FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY province ORDER BY num_listings DESC LIMIT 3;

question: List the 4 most common car colors in the dataset.
sql: SELECT color, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY color ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Which 5 car makes are the most prevalent?
sql: SELECT make, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY make ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 5;

question: List the 2 least common fuels used in the cars.
sql: SELECT fuel, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY fuel ORDER BY frequency ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 4 most common years of the cars?
sql: SELECT year, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "059_Second" GROUP BY year ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 4;

question: List the 3 highest mileages present.
sql: SELECT kms FROM "059_Second" ORDER BY kms DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 3;

question: Which 5 cars have the most photos associated?
sql: SELECT c.name, COUNT(p.id) AS photo_count FROM "059_Second" c JOIN "059_Photos" p ON c.id = p.car_id GROUP BY c.name ORDER BY photo_count DESC LIMIT 5;

question: List the 6 cars with the most power.
sql: SELECT * FROM "059_Second" ORDER BY power DESC LIMIT 6;

question: Are all transactions unique?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Transaction) AS num_unique_transactions FROM "060_Bakery";

question: Is there any transaction that took place during the night?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE period_day = 'Night';

question: Do all items have transactions recorded on weekdays?
sql: SELECT "Item", COUNT(*) AS num_transactions FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE "weekday_weekend" = 'Weekday' GROUP BY "Item" HAVING COUNT(*) > 0;

question: Are there any transactions recorded in the evening on weekends?
sql: SELECT period_day, weekday_weekend FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE period_day = 'Evening' AND weekday_weekend = 'Yes';

question: How many unique items are there in the dataset?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Item) FROM "060_Bakery";

question: On how many different days were transactions recorded?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT date_time) AS num_days FROM "060_Bakery";

question: What's the highest transaction number?
sql: SELECT MAX(Transaction) AS max_transaction FROM "060_Bakery";

question: How many transactions were made during the afternoon?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE period_day = 'Afternoon';

question: Which day period has the highest number of transactions?
sql: SELECT "period_day", SUM("Transaction") AS total_transactions FROM "060_Bakery" GROUP BY "period_day" ORDER BY total_transactions DESC LIMIT 1;

question: On weekends, what's the most commonly bought item?
sql: SELECT "Item", COUNT(*) AS num_sales FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE "weekday_weekend" = 'Weekend' GROUP BY "Item" ORDER BY num_sales DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What's the least popular item bought during weekdays?
sql: SELECT i.item, COUNT(*) AS num_purchases FROM "060_Bakery" i WHERE i.weekday_weekend = 'Weekday' GROUP BY i.item ORDER BY num_purchases ASC LIMIT 1;

question: During which period of the day is "Hot chocolate" most frequently bought?
sql: SELECT period_day, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE item = 'Hot chocolate' GROUP BY period_day ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: List the top 3 items most frequently bought in the morning.
sql: SELECT "Item", COUNT(*) AS num_purchases FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE "period_day" = 'Morning' GROUP BY "Item" ORDER BY num_purchases DESC LIMIT 3;

question: Name the bottom 4 items least purchased during the afternoon.
sql: SELECT Item, COUNT(*) AS num_purchases FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE period_day = 'Afternoon' GROUP BY Item ORDER BY num_purchases ASC LIMIT 4;

question: Identify the top 5 items sold on weekends.
sql: SELECT i.Item, SUM(i.Sales) AS total_sales FROM "060_Bakery" i WHERE i.weekday_weekend = 'Weekend' GROUP BY i.Item ORDER BY total_sales DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the 4 items tthat were bought two times in the evening?
sql: SELECT Item FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE period_day = 'Evening' GROUP BY Item HAVING COUNT(*) >= 2 LIMIT 4;

question: Which are the top 4 transaction numbers with the most items bought?
sql: SELECT "Transaction", COUNT(*) AS num_items_bought FROM "060_Bakery" GROUP BY "Transaction" ORDER BY num_items_bought DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Identify the bottom 5 transaction numbers by frequency.
sql: SELECT t.Transaction, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "060_Bakery" t GROUP BY t.Transaction ORDER BY frequency ASC LIMIT 5;

question: List the top 6 transaction numbers during which "Bread" was purchased.
sql: SELECT "Transaction", COUNT(*) AS num_transactions FROM "060_Bakery" WHERE "Item" = 'Bread' GROUP BY "Transaction" ORDER BY num_transactions DESC LIMIT 6;

question: Name the bottom 2 transaction numbers where purchases were made in the morning.
sql: SELECT t.transaction, t.period_day FROM "060_Bakery" t WHERE t.period_day = 'Morning' ORDER BY t.transaction ASC LIMIT 2;

question: Are all the reviews from Australia positive (rating > 3)?
sql: SELECT 'Reviewer_Location', 'Rating' FROM '061_Disneyland' WHERE 'Reviewer_Location' = 'Australia' AND 'Rating' > 3;

question: Is Disneyland_HongKong the most reviewed branch?
sql: SELECT Branch FROM "061_Disneyland" WHERE Branch = 'Disneyland_HongKong'

question: Are there any reviews with a rating of 1?
sql: SELECT Rating FROM "061_Disneyland" WHERE Rating = 1;

question: Does every reviewer location have at least one review with a rating of 5?
sql: SELECT rl.Reviewer_Location, COUNT(DISTINCT r.Review_ID) AS num_reviews FROM "061_Disneyland" r JOIN rl.Reviewer_Location rl ON r.Reviewer_Location = rl.Reviewer_Location WHERE r.Rating = 5 GROUP BY rl.Reviewer_Location HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT r.Review_ID) > 0;

question: How many unique reviewer locations are there?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Reviewer_Location) FROM "061_Disneyland";

question: What is the average rating for Disneyland_HongKong?
sql: SELECT AVG(Rating) AS average_rating FROM "061_Disneyland" WHERE Branch = 'Disneyland_HongKong';

question: What is the maximum review ID?
sql: SELECT MAX(Review_ID) FROM "061_Disneyland";

question: How many reviews were made in 2019?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "061_Disneyland" WHERE "Year_Month" LIKE '2019%';

question: What is the most common reviewer location?
sql: SELECT Reviewer_Location, COUNT(*) AS review_count FROM "061_Disneyland" GROUP BY Reviewer_Location ORDER BY review_count DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the branch with the lowest average rating?
sql: SELECT Branch, AVG(Rating) AS avg_rating FROM "061_Disneyland" GROUP BY Branch ORDER BY avg_rating ASC LIMIT 1;

question: In which year-month was the most negative review (rating=1) made?
sql: SELECT "Year_Month", MIN(Rating) AS min_rating FROM "061_Disneyland" WHERE Rating = 1 GROUP BY "Year_Month" ORDER BY "Year_Month" NULLS LAST;

question: What is the reviewer location with the highest average rating?
sql: SELECT Reviewer_Location, AVG(Rating) AS average_rating FROM "061_Disneyland" GROUP BY Reviewer_Location ORDER BY average_rating DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What are the top 3 reviewer locations with the most reviews?
sql: SELECT "Reviewer_Location", COUNT(*) AS review_count FROM "061_Disneyland" GROUP BY "Reviewer_Location" ORDER BY review_count DESC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the bottom 2 branches in terms of average rating?
sql: SELECT Branch, AVG(Rating) AS avg_rating FROM "061_Disneyland" GROUP BY Branch ORDER BY avg_rating ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 4 year-months with the most reviews?
sql: SELECT "Year_Month", COUNT(*) AS review_count FROM "061_Disneyland" GROUP BY "Year_Month" ORDER BY review_count DESC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the bottom 3 reviewer locations in terms of average rating?
sql: SELECT rl.Reviewer_Location, AVG(rl.Rating) AS avg_rating FROM "061_Disneyland" rl GROUP BY rl.Reviewer_Location ORDER BY avg_rating ASC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the top 5 review IDs in terms of rating?
sql: SELECT Review_ID, Rating FROM "061_Disneyland" ORDER BY Rating DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: What are the bottom 4 review IDs in terms of rating?
sql:
SELECT Review_ID, Rating
     FROM "061_Disneyland"
     ORDER BY Rating ASC
     LIMIT 4;

question: What are the top 6 ratings given by reviewers from Australia?
sql: SELECT "Reviewer_Location", "Rating" FROM "061_Disneyland" WHERE "Reviewer_Location" = 'Australia' ORDER BY "Rating" DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 6;

question: What are the bottom 3 ratings given for Disneyland_HongKong?
sql:
SELECT Branch, Rating
     FROM "061_Disneyland"
     WHERE Branch = 'Disneyland_HongKong'
     ORDER BY Rating ASC
     LIMIT 3;

question: Are all the tweets in English?
sql: SELECT lang FROM "062_Trump" WHERE lang = 'en';

question: Has the author ever been retweeted?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) > 0 AS has_been_retweeted FROM "062_Trump" WHERE "retweets" IS NOT NULL;

question: Are there any tweets with more than 10000 retweets?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "062_Trump" WHERE retweets > 10000;

question: Have any of the tweets been favorited more than 50000 times?
sql: SELECT favorites FROM "062_Trump" WHERE favorites > 50000;

question: How many unique authors are there?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT author_name) FROM "062_Trump";

question: What is the average number of retweets?
sql: SELECT AVG(retweets) AS average_retweets FROM "062_Trump";

question: What is the maximum number of favorites received for a single tweet?
sql: SELECT MAX(favorites) AS max_favorites FROM "062_Trump";

question: How many tweets were posted in 2018?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "062_Trump" WHERE date BETWEEN '2018-01-01' AND '2018-12-31';

question: What is the most common author name?
sql: SELECT author_name FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY author_name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the tweet with the most favorites?
answer: Such a beautiful and important evening! The forgotten man and woman will never be forgotten again. We will all come together as never before
sql: SELECT text, favorites FROM "062_Trump" ORDER BY favorites DESC LIMIT 1;

question: In which language is the tweet with the most retweets written?
sql: SELECT lang, SUM(retweets) AS total_retweets FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY total_retweets DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the most common language of the tweets?
sql: SELECT lang, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What are the top 3 author handlers with the most tweets?
sql: SELECT author_handler, COUNT(*) AS num_tweets FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY author_handler ORDER BY num_tweets DESC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the bottom 2 languages in terms of tweet count?
sql: SELECT lang, COUNT(*) AS tweet_count FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY lang ORDER BY tweet_count ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 4 mentioned names in the tweets?
sql: SELECT mention_names FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY mention_names ORDER BY COUNT(mention_names) DESC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the bottom 3 author names in terms of tweet count?
sql: SELECT author_name, COUNT(*) AS tweet_count FROM 062_Trump GROUP BY author_name ORDER BY tweet_count ASC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the top 5 tweet IDs in terms of retweet count?
sql: SELECT id, retweets FROM 062_Trump ORDER BY retweets DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the bottom 4 tweet IDs in terms of favorite count?
sql: SELECT id, favorites FROM "062_Trump" ORDER BY favorites ASC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the top 6 favorite counts of the tweets?
sql: SELECT favorites FROM "062_Trump" ORDER BY favorites DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 6;

question: What are the bottom 3 retweet counts of the tweets?
sql: SELECT tweet, COUNT(*) AS retweet_count FROM "062_Trump" GROUP BY tweet ORDER BY retweet_count ASC LIMIT 3;

question: Are there any organizations in the dataset?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "063_Influencers" WHERE "is_organization" = 'Yes';

question: Are there any individuals (non-organizations) in the dataset?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "063_Influencers" WHERE is_organization = 'No';

question: Do all entities have a picture?
sql: SELECT "pic" FROM "063_Influencers";

question: Are there any entities with a weight greater than 500?
sql: SELECT * FROM "063_Influencers" WHERE weight > 500;

question: How many unique communities are there?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT community) FROM "063_Influencers";

question: What is the average page rank norm?
sql: SELECT AVG(page_rank_norm) AS average_page_rank_norm FROM "063_Influencers";

question: What is the maximum weight of an entity?
sql: SELECT MAX(weight) FROM "063_Influencers";

question: How many entities have a community identifier of 16744206?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "063_Influencers" WHERE community = 16744206;

question: What is the most common name?
sql: SELECT name FROM "063_Influencers" GROUP BY name ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

question: Which entity has the highest page rank norm?
sql: SELECT name, page_rank_norm FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY page_rank_norm DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 1;

question: What is the picture URL of the entity with the maximum weight?

question: Which entity has the highest y-coordinate?

question: What are the top 3 entity names with the highest weights?

question: What are the bottom 2 entities in terms of page rank norm?
sql: SELECT name, page_rank_norm FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY page_rank_norm ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the top 4 entities with the highest x-coordinates?
sql: SELECT name, x FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY x DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 4;

question: What are the bottom 3 entities in terms of y-coordinates?

SELECT name, y
     FROM "063_Influencers"
     ORDER BY y ASC
     LIMIT 3;

question: What are the top 5 entity IDs in terms of weight?
sql: SELECT id, weight FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY weight DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: What are the bottom 4 entity IDs in terms of page rank norm?
sql: SELECT id, page_rank_norm FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY page_rank_norm ASC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the top 6 page rank norms of the entities?
sql: SELECT page_rank_norm FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY page_rank_norm DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 6;

question: What are the bottom 3 weights of the entities?
sql: SELECT weight FROM "063_Influencers" ORDER BY weight ASC LIMIT 3;

question: Are there any animals with feathers in the dataset?
sql: SELECT 'feathers' FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE 'feathers' IS NOT NULL;

question: Are there any venomous animals in the dataset?
sql: SELECT venomous FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE venomous = 'Yes';

question: Do all animals breathe?
sql: SELECT breathes FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE breathes = 'Yes';

question: Are there any domesticated animals in the dataset?
sql: SELECT domestic FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE domestic = 'Yes';

question: How many unique types of animals are there?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT class_type) FROM "064_Clustering";

question: What is the average number of legs?
sql: SELECT AVG(legs) AS average_legs FROM "064_Clustering";

question: What is the maximum number of legs an animal has?
sql: SELECT MAX(legs) FROM "064_Clustering";

question: How many animals are there with 2 legs?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE legs = 2;

question: What is the most common class type?
sql: SELECT class_type, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "064_Clustering" GROUP BY class_type ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the name of the animal with 8 legs?
sql: SELECT animal_name FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE legs = 8;

question: What is the class type of the animal with the most legs?
sql: SELECT c.class_type, MAX(c.legs) AS max_legs FROM "064_Clustering" c GROUP BY c.class_type ORDER BY max_legs DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the name of the animal that is venomous?
sql: SELECT animal_name FROM "064_Clustering" WHERE venomous = 'Yes';

question: What are the top 3 animal names with the most legs?
sql: SELECT animal_name, legs FROM "064_Clustering" ORDER BY legs DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 3;

question: What are the bottom 2 animal names in terms of the number of legs?
sql: SELECT animal_name, legs FROM "064_Clustering" ORDER BY legs ASC LIMIT 2;

question: What are the most common 4 class types with the most animals?
sql: SELECT class_type, COUNT(*) AS num_animals FROM "064_Clustering" GROUP BY class_type ORDER BY num_animals DESC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the least common 3 class types with the least animals?
sql: SELECT class_type, COUNT(*) AS num_animals FROM "064_Clustering" GROUP BY class_type ORDER BY num_animals ASC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the most common 5 class types with the most combined total legs?
sql: SELECT c.class_type, SUM(c.legs) AS total_legs FROM "064_Clustering" c GROUP BY c.class_type ORDER BY total_legs DESC LIMIT 5;

question: What are the bottom 4 class types with the least combined total legs?
sql: SELECT c.class_type, SUM(c.legs) AS total_legs FROM "064_Clustering" c GROUP BY c.class_type ORDER BY total_legs ASC LIMIT 4;

question: What are the most common 6 numbers of legs that animals have?
sql: SELECT legs, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "064_Clustering" GROUP BY legs ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 6;

question: What are the least common 3 numbers of legs that animals have?
sql: SELECT legs, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "064_Clustering" GROUP BY legs ORDER BY frequency ASC LIMIT 3;

question: Are all the quantities greater than 0?
sql: SELECT Quantity > 0 AS all_quantities_greater_than_zero FROM "065_RFM";

question: Are all the unit prices greater than 0?
sql: SELECT UnitPrice FROM "065_RFM" WHERE UnitPrice > 0;

question: Are there any missing customer IDs?
sql: SELECT "CustomerID" FROM "065_RFM" WHERE "CustomerID" IS NULL;

question: Are there any transactions from the United Kingdom?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "065_RFM" WHERE Country = 'United Kingdom';

question: How many unique stock codes are there?
sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT StockCode) FROM "065_RFM";

question: What is the average unit price?
sql: SELECT AVG(UnitPrice) AS average_unit_price FROM "065_RFM";

question: What is the maximum quantity ordered in a single transaction?
sql: SELECT MAX(Quantity) AS max_quantity FROM "065_RFM";

question: How many transactions were made in the United Kingdom?
sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "065_RFM" WHERE Country = 'United Kingdom';

question: Which country made the most transactions?
sql: SELECT Country, COUNT(*) AS num_transactions FROM "065_RFM" GROUP BY Country ORDER BY num_transactions DESC LIMIT 1;

question: What is the description of the item with the highest unit price?
sql: SELECT Description, UnitPrice FROM "065_RFM" ORDER BY UnitPrice DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 1;

question: What is the description of the item with the highest quantity ordered?
sql:
SELECT Description, Quantity
     FROM "065_RFM"
     ORDER BY Quantity DESC
     LIMIT 1;

question: Which country does the customer with the lowest ID come from?
sql: SELECT Country, MIN(CustomerID) AS min_customer_id FROM "065_RFM" GROUP BY Country ORDER BY min_customer_id NULLS LAST;

question: What are the descriptions of the top 3 items with the highest quantities ordered?
answer: ['PAPER CRAFT , LITTLE BIRDIE', 'MEDIUM CERAMIC TOP STORAGE JAR', 'ASSTD DESIGN 3D PAPER STICKERS']
sql: SELECT Description, Quantity FROM "065_RFM" ORDER BY Quantity DESC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the descriptions of the bottom 2 items with the lowest quantities ordered?
answer: ['PAPER CRAFT , LITTLE BIRDIE', 'MEDIUM CERAMIC TOP STORAGE JAR']
sql:
SELECT Description, Quantity
     FROM "065_RFM"
     ORDER BY Quantity ASC
     LIMIT 2;

question: Which 4 countries made the most transactions?
sql: SELECT Country, COUNT(*) AS num_transactions FROM "065_RFM" GROUP BY Country ORDER BY num_transactions DESC LIMIT 4;

question: Which 3 countries made the least transactions?
sql: SELECT Country, COUNT(*) AS num_transactions FROM "065_RFM" GROUP BY Country ORDER BY num_transactions ASC LIMIT 3;

question: What are the invoice numbers of the top 5 transactions with the highest quantities ordered?
sql: SELECT i.InvoiceNo, i.Quantity FROM 065_RFM i ORDER BY i.Quantity DESC NULLS LAST LIMIT 5;

question: What are the stock codes of the bottom 4 transactions with the lowest quantities ordered?
sql:
SELECT i.InvoiceNo, i.Quantity
     FROM "065_RFM" i
     ORDER BY i.Quantity ASC
     LIMIT 4;

question: What are the six most commonly ordered quantities?
sql: SELECT Quantity, COUNT(*) AS frequency FROM "065_RFM" GROUP BY Quantity ORDER BY frequency DESC LIMIT 6;

question: What are the three least commonly ordered quantities?
sql: SELECT Quantity FROM "065_RFM" GROUP BY Quantity ORDER BY COUNT(Quantity) ASC LIMIT 3;
